alert.note: Alert for Mono (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 19 at 7:10PM PDT until July 19 at 10:00PM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: The National Weather Service in Reno has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southern Mono County in northern California... * Until 1000 PM PDT. * At 710 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Fish Lake Valley, Oasis, White Mountain Peak, Junction CA 266 And NV 264, Junction CA 266 And CA 168, and Montgomery Peak. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
